title: Spinach Substitutes

items.name: Kale
items.details: Sturdier, slightly bitter. Great for sauteing or soups. Chop and lightly cook when substituting in pasta dishes.

items.name: Swiss chard
items.details: Milder, tender. Works well in most spinach recipes. Use chopped leaves and tender stems.

items.name: Arugula
items.details: Peppery flavor. Best for salads or light cooking. Add right at the end to wilt when used in pasta.

items.name: Baby bok choy
items.details: Mild flavor. Works in stir-fries and soups. Chop and saute when substituting.

items.name: Collard greens
items.details: Hearty texture. Great for cooked dishes but not ideal for raw applications.

items.name: Romaine or butter lettuce
items.details: Works for raw dishes only. Lacks spinach's texture when cooked.

notes: The best substitute depends on the specific dish. For a Spicy Tomato and Roasted Red Pepper Pasta, the top choices are kale (chopped and lightly cooked), Swiss chard, or arugula (added at the end to wilt).
